pull.title: test: Check already deactivated network stays suspended after dumptxoutset
pull.body: Follow-up to #30817 which covered the robustness of `dumptxoutset`: network is deactivated during the run but re-activated even when an issue was encountered. But it did not cover the case if the user had deactivated the network themselves before. In that case the user may want the network to stay off so the network is not reactivated after `dumptxoutset` finishes. A test for this behavior is added here.

tested ACK 72c9a1fe94f927220d3159f516fda684ae9d4caa

Great addition.
Added improper `node.setnetworkactive()` lines above each call to `self.check_expected_network()` to ensure the checks would fail. They did (no surprise).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,17 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
         self.num_nodes = 1
 
+    def check_expected_network(self, node, active):
+        rev_file = node.blocks_path / "rev00000.dat"
+        bogus_file = node.blocks_path / "bogus.dat"
+        rev_file.rename(bogus_file)
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(
comments.body:
nit:
```suggestion
        self.log.info(f"Test that dumptxoutset with rollback type fails given an invalid height")
        assert_raises_rpc_error(
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,17 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
         self.num_nodes = 1
 
+    def check_expected_network(self, node, active):
+        rev_file = node.blocks_path / "rev00000.dat"
+        bogus_file = node.blocks_path / "bogus.dat"
+        rev_file.rename(bogus_file)
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(
comments.body: Hm, I don't think it makes sense to add that. First, the actual error here is not the point of this test. This test is about the network activity and even if it covers something else I would like that to be structured differently then and have the logs be in `run_test`. Where it is now it would also be printed twice. Second, the content isn't right: The reason this fails is not the rollback height, it's because the rev file can not be read, so the rolling back action failed as in, it could not reach the requested height. But if the re file wasn't moved above there should be no error raised.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,17 @@ def set_test_params(self):

         self.num_nodes = 1

+        bogus_file = node.blocks_path / "bogus.dat"
+        rev_file.rename(bogus_file)
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(
comments.body: Yes, that's correct. Thanks! I got confused by the error message, block height was actually valid (`COINBASE_MATURITY = 100`), then we are missing testing the rollback type given an invalid height (?).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,17 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
         self.num_nodes = 1
 
+    def check_expected_network(self, node, active):
+        rev_file = node.blocks_path / "rev00000.dat"
+        bogus_file = node.blocks_path / "bogus.dat"
+        rev_file.rename(bogus_file)
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(
comments.body: Seems like we don't have a test for that explicitly. It's handled by `ParseHashOrHeight()` which used in other RPCs and is covered in other tests but still would be good to have it for `dumptxoutset`. Do you want to open a PR for that @pablomartin4btc ? Otherwise, I can add it here.

comments.body: I can open a new PR to test the rollback type option with both a valid and invalid heights. I'll do as soon as this one gets merged. Thanks.
